post_text:
Tomorrow is North Texas Giving Day, and the Educational Foundation Needs Your Help

North Texas Giving Day officially begins on 9/17! Tomorrow, September 17, is North Texas Giving Day in DFW. Funds raised will help fund teacher and student grants through the CFBISD Educational Foundation.

𝐇𝐎𝐖 𝐓𝐎 𝐆𝐈𝐕𝐄

You can make online donations at:

https://www.northtexasgivingday.org/carrollton-farmers-branch-isd-educational-foundation

Donations online will be accepted through midnight.

Thank you in advance for your support of the CFBISD Educational Foundation and its mission to support our district's teachers and students. Together We Can! ❤️

𝐂𝐅𝐁𝐈𝐒𝐃 𝐩𝐫𝐞𝐬𝐞𝐧𝐭𝐬 𝐕𝐢𝐫𝐭𝐮𝐚𝐥 𝐂𝐨𝐥𝐥𝐞𝐠𝐞 𝐍𝐢𝐠𝐡𝐭

Attention parents and students... CFBISD is offering a virtual college night where you can interact with colleges and universities from across the country.

Online on Thursday, Sept. 17 from 6 PM - 8 PM

Register Here: https://falltacrao.swoogo.com/2020virtual

𝐇𝐞𝐫𝐞 𝐢𝐬 𝐰𝐡𝐚𝐭 𝐲𝐨𝐮 𝐜𝐚𝐧 𝐝𝐨 𝐝𝐮𝐫𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐲𝐨𝐮𝐫 𝐜𝐨𝐥𝐥𝐞𝐠𝐞 𝐟𝐚𝐢𝐫:

👩‍🎓 Visit College and University Booths
👩‍🎓 Chat with Admission Representatives
👩‍🎓 Schedule a Virtual Appointment to ask additional questions

𝐕𝐢𝐞𝐰 𝐚𝐧 𝐈𝐧𝐟𝐨 𝐒𝐞𝐬𝐬𝐢𝐨𝐧 𝐨𝐧:

👩‍🎓 Understanding the Admissions Process
👩‍🎓 Scholarships and Financial Aid
👩‍🎓 How to Start Your College Search

We hope to see you there...

Students and teachers in CFBISD are almost one month into the 2020-2021 school year. We are proud of the hard work and dedication both our teachers and students show as they adjust to Remote and Traditional Learning.

CFBISD has created a website where parents, students, teachers, and staff can find status updates/announcements, resources, and other information about CFBISD school operations impacted by COVID-19.

Click the link below to visit the website:

https://www.cfbisd.edu/students/2020-2021-back-to-school

post_text:
Welcome Back Traditional Onsite Learners

CFBISD welcomes students back to our campuses for traditional onsite learning. Families have the option to choose either Remote Learning or Traditional Learning with our teachers.

We love each of our students, and wish you a successful day back in the classroom.

Are You Looking for a Good Book???
Barbara Bush Middle School Book Discussion

Abby Ramos, a teacher at Barbara Bush Middle School in the Carrollton-Farmers Branch Independent School District, discusses the book When I Was the Greatest by Jason Reynolds during their online Remote Learning lesson.

CFBISD teachers are making an impact even over the streaming video. Thank you for all of your hard work to make the first week of school a success.

post_text:
Welcome Back to School

The CFBISD Leadership Team welcomes students and staff back to school for the 2020-2021 school year. School starts on Monday, August 17.

In the first three weeks in CFBISD, students will be doing virtual Remote Learning. Parents and students have an option to resume traditional, campus learning on Tuesday, September 8.

Even though the first day of school will be different, we encourage students and parents to share their first-day pics using the hashtag #CFBFirstDay on all of your social media profiles.

Even though the first day of school will be different, we encourage students and parents to share their first-day pics using the hashtag #CFBFirstDay on all of your social media profiles.

𝐑𝐞𝐭𝐮𝐫𝐧 𝐭𝐨 𝐋𝐞𝐚𝐫𝐧 – 𝐀 𝐌𝐞𝐬𝐬𝐚𝐠𝐞 𝐟𝐨𝐫 𝐂𝐅𝐁𝐈𝐒𝐃 𝐅𝐚𝐦𝐢𝐥𝐢𝐞𝐬

Dr. West shares tips on how your child can have a successful start to the school year.

𝟏. 𝐅𝐚𝐜𝐞 - We want to see our students each day
𝟐. 𝐓𝐞𝐚𝐜𝐡𝐞𝐫 𝐏𝐥𝐚𝐧𝐧𝐢𝐧𝐠 - our staff will be assessing the needs of your child
𝟑. 𝐃𝐞𝐯𝐢𝐜𝐞 𝐒𝐮𝐩𝐩𝐨𝐫𝐭 - Schools have been deploying devices each day this week
𝟒. 𝐁𝐮𝐢𝐥𝐝 - we want to build trust with our families to have a great school year

We are all in this together. Thank you for your support.

post_text:
𝐖𝐞𝐥𝐜𝐨𝐦𝐞 𝐭𝐨 𝐂𝐚𝐧𝐯𝐚𝐬 𝐢𝐧 𝐂𝐅𝐁𝐈𝐒𝐃: 𝐀 𝐓𝐨𝐨𝐥 𝐟𝐨𝐫 𝐑𝐞𝐦𝐨𝐭𝐞 𝐋𝐞𝐚𝐫𝐧𝐢𝐧𝐠

All students will be using the Canvas during the 2020-2021 school year. Once a student logs into Canvas, they will be able to access other grade level platforms such as Seesaw and Google Classroom.

Remote Learning will provide students with the opportunity to log in remotely to engage in daily instruction and learning activities with their teachers. Students will learn through teacher-led instruction and peer collaboration to gain appropriate academic and social-emotional skills.

Learn More About Canvas by clicking the links below:

𝐈𝐧𝐭𝐫𝐨𝐝𝐮𝐜𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧 𝐭𝐨 𝐂𝐚𝐧𝐯𝐚𝐬 𝐟𝐨𝐫 𝐂𝐅𝐁𝐈𝐒𝐃 𝐟𝐨𝐫 𝐏𝐚𝐫𝐞𝐧𝐭𝐬 𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝐒𝐭𝐮𝐝𝐞𝐧𝐭𝐬

https://youtu.be/T6v9PV_9Xfg

𝐈𝐧𝐭𝐫𝐨𝐝𝐮𝐜𝐜𝐢𝐨́𝐧 𝐚 𝐂𝐚𝐧𝐯𝐚𝐬 𝐞𝐧 𝐂𝐅𝐁𝐈𝐒𝐃

https://youtu.be/ndifgAtWwz4

Thank you for your understanding and patience. Your teachers and administrators are working hard to provide the best possible education for your child.

Carrollton-Farmers Branch ISD was informed on Tuesday about a new ruling from the Texas Attorney General, announcing another change in guidance regarding the governing authority for whether a local health authority may order the closure of schools.

CFBISD leadership is evaluating the guidance provided in the ruling and will update our community should any changes be made to our current reopening of schools plan.

𝐂𝐅𝐁𝐈𝐒𝐃 𝐏𝐚𝐫𝐭𝐧𝐞𝐫𝐬 𝐰𝐢𝐭𝐡 𝐆𝐞𝐫𝐦𝐢𝐧𝐚𝐭𝐨𝐫 𝐭𝐨 𝐌𝐚𝐤𝐞 𝐎𝐮𝐫 𝐒𝐜𝐡𝐨𝐨𝐥𝐬 𝐒𝐚𝐟𝐞

Safety for our students and staff is our top priority.

CFBISD will use Germinator's Mobile Sanitizing service to disinfect all district facilities before opening the fall semester.

Germinator Mobile Sanitizing & Disinfecting is a breakthrough technology that redefines the concept of a healthy living space.

Their process uses organic compounds combined with a microbial barrier application, which helps keep schools sanitary for many months without reapplication.

𝐏𝐚𝐫𝐚 𝐭𝐞𝐧𝐞𝐫 𝐚𝐜𝐜𝐞𝐬𝐨 𝐚 𝐥𝐨𝐬 𝐬𝐮𝐛𝐭𝐢́𝐭𝐮𝐥𝐨𝐬 𝐞𝐧 𝐄𝐬𝐩𝐚𝐧̃𝐨𝐥:

Haga clic en la rueda al lado de las letras CC y toque donde dice “English-Auto Translated”.

Luego toque “Auto Translate” y seleccione Español.

𝐖𝐡𝐚𝐭 𝐖𝐢𝐥𝐥 𝐑𝐞𝐦𝐨𝐭𝐞 𝐋𝐞𝐚𝐫𝐧𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐋𝐨𝐨𝐤 𝐋𝐢𝐤𝐞 𝐢𝐧 𝐂𝐅𝐁𝐈𝐒𝐃
[VIDEO SLIDESHOW] - Spanish Subtitles Available

Families may choose the CFBISD remote model of learning for their child if they wish their child to attend school five days a week at home in an online learning environment.

In all grades Pre-K through 12th, CFBISD's Remote Learning online classwork and instruction will be much like your child's traditional classroom with engaging lessons from certified teachers.

Remote Learning activities are designed to guarantee that your child will be learning at the highest level and encourage a love of learning. Our goal for Remote Learning is to work together to ensure students gain the academic skills necessary for their future success, and still have them participate in the electives and extracurricular activities they love.

We appreciate our patience as we adapt to the new school year.

Watch Here: https://youtu.be/FJFjCBZjoeY

Remote Learning will take place for all students during the first three weeks of the school year in CFBISD.

The school year will start on August 17 with all students learning remotely. Please be assured that we will have systems in place to provide a robust Remote Learning program for your child(ren).

See the attached letter from Dr. Chapman, Superintendent of Schools.

Thank you for your patience & understanding.

post_text:
𝐂𝐅𝐁𝐈𝐒𝐃 𝐑𝐞𝐥𝐞𝐚𝐬𝐞𝐬 𝐑𝐞𝐨𝐩𝐞𝐧𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐩𝐥𝐚𝐧 𝐟𝐨𝐫 𝟐𝟎𝟐𝟎 - 𝟐𝟎𝟐𝟏 𝐬𝐜𝐡𝐨𝐨𝐥 𝐲𝐞𝐚𝐫

Dear CFBISD Families,

We are pleased to share our "reopening of schools" plan for the 2020-2021 school year. We look forward to welcoming our students back in the fall, whether in-person or virtually.

The District will offer both Traditional Onsite Learning and Remote Learning Options for our students. Please note that we are working diligently to ensure a safe and healthy environment for our staff and students and provide engaging learning opportunities for all students.

Click here https://cfbisd.edu/reopen/ to learn more about the 2020-2021 Traditional Onsite Learning and Remote Learning options.

We hope the information shared in this link will be helpful as you carefully consider both learning options. Later this week, we will share additional information (i.e., schedules times) to help you make the best choice for your child(ren).

Thank you for your patience as we work through these challenging times together.

Sincerely,

CFBISD Administration

We are excited to announce the CFBISD board of Trustees approved the following items on July 7, 2020...

Making the school year safer and better for our students, teachers and staff.

- 2,100 New Laptops for Teachers to Improve Instruction
- New touch Screen Devices for the Classroom
- An Additional 1,500 Internet HotSpots for Students
- Sanitizing and Disinfection Service for Buildings

Parents wishing to pick up 5 breakfasts and 5 lunches for their children should bring their children with them OR bring any one of the following items for each child not present.

- Official letter/email listing children enrolled
- Individual student report cards
- Attendance record from parent portal of school
- Birth certificate for children
- Student ID cards

Unfortunately, we cannot provide meals without children being present or proper documentation.

CFBISD Athletes Earn Academic All-State Honors

Although the COVID-19 pandemic deprived student-athletes all across Carrollton-Farmers Branch ISD a satisfactory conclusion to their respective spring seasons, several were still recognized for their work in the classroom.

The Texas High School Coaches Association recently finalized its academic all-state selections from the 2019-20 school year, and numerous athletes from Creekview, Newman Smith and R.L. Turner were honored among the state’s springtime sports.

post_text:
𝐔𝐩𝐝𝐚𝐭𝐞 𝐨𝐧 𝟐𝟎𝟐𝟎-𝟐𝟏 𝐬𝐜𝐡𝐨𝐨𝐥 𝐲𝐞𝐚𝐫 𝐟𝐫𝐨𝐦 𝐂𝐅𝐁𝐈𝐒𝐃

Dear CFBISD Families,

Today Governor Greg Abbott and Texas Education Commissioner Mike Morath shared information regarding the start of 2020-21 school year.

"It will be safe for Texas public school students, teachers, and staff to return to school campuses for in-person instruction this fall. But there will also be flexibility for families with health concerns so that their children can be educated remotely if the parent so chooses,” said Texas Education Commissioner Mike Morath.

CFBISD is currently working on specific reentry plans for the 2020-21 school year. The District will finalize and share these reentry plans after the release of additional information from TEA.

We look forward to communicating with our students, parents, teachers and staff as we receive additional guidance from the state and TEA. Thank you for your continued patience and understanding as we navigate through these uncertain times together.

Sincerely,

CFBISD Administration

Dear CFBISD Families,

Today Governor Greg Abbott and Texas Education Commissioner Mike Morath shared information regarding the start of 2020-21 school year.

"It will be safe for Texas public school students, teachers, and staff to return to school campuses for in-person instruction this fall. But there will also be flexibility for families with health concerns so that their children can be educated remotely if the parent so chooses,” said Texas Education Commissioner Mike Morath.

CFBISD is currently working on specific reentry plans for the 2020-21 school year. The District will finalize and share these reentry plans after the release of additional information from TEA.

We look forward to communicating with our students, parents, teachers and staff as we receive additional guidance from the state and TEA. Thank you for your continued patience and understanding as we navigate through these uncertain times together.

Sincerely,

CFBISD Administration

post_text:
𝐓𝐞𝐚𝐜𝐡𝐞𝐫𝐬 & 𝐒𝐭𝐚𝐟𝐟 𝐢𝐧 𝐂𝐅𝐁𝐈𝐒𝐃 𝐌𝐚𝐤𝐞 𝐏𝐨𝐰𝐞𝐫𝐟𝐮𝐥 𝐂𝐨𝐧𝐧𝐞𝐜𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧𝐬 𝐭𝐨 𝐒𝐭𝐮𝐝𝐞𝐧𝐭𝐬 𝐃𝐮𝐫𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐒𝐜𝐡𝐨𝐨𝐥 𝐂𝐥𝐨𝐬𝐮𝐫𝐞𝐬

That moment during Spring Break, when schools shut their doors in the state of Texas... parents, students, the community felt learning was over. But when teachers in the Carrollton-Farmers Branch Independent School District face challenges... they keep fighting.

And when no one thought it was going to be possible—even educators themselves. Teachers in CFBISD kept the spark alive.

From being heartbroken, CFBISD found a way to empower our students. Teachers and principals made them feel connected. And they did it time and time again.

Through love... through compassion... through being connected...

Our educators found a way to continue learning and continue loving their students.

If we have learned anything from our educators in CFBISD, it's that no matter the circumstances, Together We Can!

That moment during Spring Break, when schools shut their doors in the state of Texas... parents, students, the community felt learning was over. But when teachers in the Carrollton-Farmers Branch Independent School District face challenges... they keep fighting.

And when no one thought it was going to be possible—even educators themselves. Teachers in CFBISD kept the spark alive.

From being heartbroken, CFBISD found a way to empower our students. Teachers and principals made them feel connected. And they did it time and time again.

Our kindergarten program is like no other. Innovative classrooms with passionate, caring teachers, prepare your child for their unique path to a successful academic career.

Kindergarten has dramatically changed over the past 20 years, and our district is committed to helping your child learn more, and achieve more.

We, in partnership with each and every parent, help mold students into leaders that will shape our future – a bright future for sure. We are committed to high achievement for each and every student.

post_text:
Field Middle School - CFBISD Bond Update - June School Tour 2020

Chief Operations Officer, Malcolm Mulroney, of the Carrollton-Farmers Branch Independent School District gives an update on the bond construction taking place at Vivian Field Middle School in Farmers Branch.

After twenty years, CFBISD is renovating the campus in partnership with Jackson Construction. Vivian Field Middle School will be a state of the art campus when the project is completed.

Renovations will include:

- Fine Arts classroom and performance space improvements
- Collaboration rooms
- Exterior Upgrades
- Interior upgrades
- Mechanical, electrical, plumbing, systems upgrades
- New marquee
- Landscaping improvements
- Kitchen renovation and new equipment
- Athletic track improvements

Find more information on the Carrollton-Farmers Branch ISD bond at www.cfbbond.com

post_text:
CFBISD Summer Meals Program launches

The Carrollton-Farmers Branch ISD Student Nutrition Department will serve meals during the months of June and July. Beginning June 3rd, Curbside Grab and Go meal service will continue under the National School Meal Program through July 22nd

At the specified locations, distribution of five (5) Breakfast and five (5) Lunches is available to any child present 18 years of age & under every Wednesday and NO applications needed for summer meals.

In the absence of children, parents wishing to pick up meals should bring any of the following items for each child not present.

- Official letter/email from school listing children enrolled
- Individual student report cards
- Attendance record from parent portal of website
- Birth certificate for children
- Student ID cards

Click Below to See Pick-Up Locations in CFBISD:

https://cfbisd.edu/nutrition-services/summer-meals-program/

Carrollton-Farmers Branch ISD is excited to announce that graduation ceremonies for the Class of 2020 will be held at the Texas Motor Speedway in Fort Worth, Texas.

The ceremonies will take place as follows:

Saturday, May 30

👩‍🎓 8:00 AM – Early College High & Ranchview High
👩‍🎓 11:00 AM - Newman Smith High
👩‍🎓 3:00 PM – Creekview High
👩‍🎓 7:00 PM – RL Turner High

WE LOVE OUR SENIORS!!!

post_text:
𝐌𝐚𝐲 𝟏𝟐 𝐢𝐬 "𝐖𝐞 𝐋𝐨𝐯𝐞 𝐎𝐮𝐫 𝐒𝐞𝐧𝐢𝐨𝐫𝐬" 𝐃𝐚𝐲

The City of Carrollton will honor the graduating class of 2020 w/ a proclamation presented by Mayor Falconer at the May 12 City Council meeting declaring Tue., May 12 the “Class of 2020 Senior Day” in Carrollton, recognizing this year's seniors & their families’ hard work & accomplishment.

Thank you to 𝐌𝐚𝐲𝐨𝐫 𝐊𝐞𝐯𝐢𝐧 𝐅𝐚𝐥𝐜𝐨𝐧𝐞𝐫 and the entire 𝐂𝐢𝐭𝐲 𝐨𝐟 𝐂𝐚𝐫𝐫𝐨𝐥𝐥𝐭𝐨𝐧 for the special message to our high school seniors. Thank you for thinking of us.

CFBISD encourages parents and community members to celebrate the Class of 2020 on their social media accounts on Tuesday, May 12.

Show our CFBISD seniors how much we care for them as they enter the last month of their school career in the district.

post_text:
𝐇𝐞𝐲, 𝐂𝐅𝐁𝐈𝐒𝐃 𝐏𝐚𝐫𝐞𝐧𝐭𝐬 & 𝐅𝐮𝐭𝐮𝐫𝐞 𝐂𝐅𝐁𝐈𝐒𝐃 𝐏𝐚𝐫𝐞𝐧𝐭𝐬...

Did you know that your child needs to enroll each year in our system so our records are up to date? Even if you have been in CFBISD in the past, we still need you to register your child.

www.enrollcfb.com

Today would be a beautiful day to complete this process. Our enrollment website is open for current CFBISD families as well as families that want to join our amazing district.

From Pre-Kindergarten to high school, we have incredible programs that will fit the passions of YOUR CHILD...

𝐒𝐓𝐄𝐌, 𝐅𝐢𝐧𝐞 𝐀𝐫𝐭𝐬, 𝐂𝐨𝐝𝐢𝐧𝐠, 𝐄𝐧𝐠𝐢𝐧𝐞𝐞𝐫𝐢𝐧𝐠, 𝐌𝐞𝐝𝐢𝐚, 𝐋𝐚𝐰, 𝐀𝐮𝐭𝐨 𝐁𝐨𝐝𝐲, 𝐅𝐚𝐬𝐡𝐢𝐨𝐧 𝐃𝐞𝐬𝐢𝐠𝐧, 𝐌𝐞𝐝𝐢𝐜𝐚𝐥, 𝐀𝐠𝐫𝐢𝐜𝐮𝐥𝐭𝐮𝐫𝐞, 𝐒𝐩𝐨𝐫𝐭𝐬 𝐌𝐞𝐝𝐢𝐜𝐢𝐧𝐞, 𝐈𝐧𝐭𝐞𝐫𝐧𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧𝐚𝐥 𝐁𝐚𝐜𝐜𝐚𝐥𝐚𝐮𝐫𝐞𝐚𝐭𝐞, 𝐄𝐚𝐫𝐥𝐲 𝐂𝐨𝐥𝐥𝐞𝐠𝐞, 𝐆𝐫𝐚𝐩𝐡𝐢𝐜 𝐃𝐞𝐬𝐢𝐠𝐧, 𝐆𝐚𝐦𝐢𝐧𝐠, 𝐆𝐢𝐟𝐭𝐞𝐝 𝐄𝐝𝐮𝐜𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧, 𝐚𝐭𝐡𝐥𝐞𝐭𝐢𝐜𝐬, 𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝐦𝐮𝐜𝐡, 𝐦𝐮𝐜𝐡 𝐦𝐨𝐫𝐞...
text:
𝐇𝐞𝐲, 𝐂𝐅𝐁𝐈𝐒𝐃 𝐏𝐚𝐫𝐞𝐧𝐭𝐬 & 𝐅𝐮𝐭𝐮𝐫𝐞 𝐂𝐅𝐁𝐈𝐒𝐃 𝐏𝐚𝐫𝐞𝐧𝐭𝐬...

Did you know that your child needs to enroll each year in our system so our records are up to date? Even if you have been in CFBISD in the past, we still need you to register your child.

www.enrollcfb.com

Today would be a beautiful day to complete this process. Our enrollment website is open for current CFBISD families as well as families that want to join our amazing district.

From Pre-Kindergarten to high school, we have incredible programs that will fit the passions of YOUR CHILD...

𝐒𝐓𝐄𝐌, 𝐅𝐢𝐧𝐞 𝐀𝐫𝐭𝐬, 𝐂𝐨𝐝𝐢𝐧𝐠, 𝐄𝐧𝐠𝐢𝐧𝐞𝐞𝐫𝐢𝐧𝐠, 𝐌𝐞𝐝𝐢𝐚, 𝐋𝐚𝐰, 𝐀𝐮𝐭𝐨 𝐁𝐨𝐝𝐲, 𝐅𝐚𝐬𝐡𝐢𝐨𝐧 𝐃𝐞𝐬𝐢𝐠𝐧, 𝐌𝐞𝐝𝐢𝐜𝐚𝐥, 𝐀𝐠𝐫𝐢𝐜𝐮𝐥𝐭𝐮𝐫𝐞, 𝐒𝐩𝐨𝐫𝐭𝐬 𝐌𝐞𝐝𝐢𝐜𝐢𝐧𝐞, 𝐈𝐧𝐭𝐞𝐫𝐧𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧𝐚𝐥 𝐁𝐚𝐜𝐜𝐚𝐥𝐚𝐮𝐫𝐞𝐚𝐭𝐞, 𝐄𝐚𝐫𝐥𝐲 𝐂𝐨𝐥𝐥𝐞𝐠𝐞, 𝐆𝐫𝐚𝐩𝐡𝐢𝐜 𝐃𝐞𝐬𝐢𝐠𝐧, 𝐆𝐚𝐦𝐢𝐧𝐠, 𝐆𝐢𝐟𝐭𝐞𝐝 𝐄𝐝𝐮𝐜𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧, 𝐚𝐭𝐡𝐥𝐞𝐭𝐢𝐜𝐬, 𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝐦𝐮𝐜𝐡, 𝐦𝐮𝐜𝐡 𝐦𝐨𝐫𝐞...

𝐖𝐞 𝐋𝐨𝐯𝐞 𝐎𝐮𝐫 𝐒𝐞𝐧𝐢𝐨𝐫𝐬 𝐃𝐚𝐲—𝐌𝐚𝐲 𝟏𝟐

❤️ Let’s Make May 12 Special ❤️

CFBISD encourages parents and community members to celebrate the Class of 2020 on their social media accounts on Tuesday, May 12.

𝐒𝐡𝐨𝐰 𝐨𝐮𝐫 𝐂𝐅𝐁𝐈𝐒𝐃 𝐬𝐞𝐧𝐢𝐨𝐫𝐬 𝐡𝐨𝐰 𝐦𝐮𝐜𝐡 𝐰𝐞 𝐜𝐚𝐫𝐞 𝐟𝐨𝐫 𝐭𝐡𝐞𝐦 𝐚𝐬 𝐭𝐡𝐞𝐲 𝐞𝐧𝐭𝐞𝐫 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐥𝐚𝐬𝐭 𝐦𝐨𝐧𝐭𝐡 𝐨𝐟 𝐭𝐡𝐞𝐢𝐫 𝐬𝐜𝐡𝐨𝐨𝐥 𝐜𝐚𝐫𝐞𝐞𝐫 𝐢𝐧 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐝𝐢𝐬𝐭𝐫𝐢𝐜𝐭. ❤️❤️❤️

Here are a few ideas we are sharing on social media for parents or citizens to do:

❤️ Show love for our graduates by posting spirit signs
❤️ Host a drive-through parade in a graduates neighborhood;
❤️ Decorate your car
❤️ Post congratulations messages on social media

Let's Make May 12th Special for the Class of 2020!!!

Carrollton-Farmers Branch ISD can’t wait for their students to get back on campus to see their new football, baseball and softball fields. The pride level will be raised to new heights as Hellas’ Matrix Turf® with Helix Technology® is being installed at four on-campus high school football fields with a Cushdrain shock pad under each facility.

In addition to the new football fields, CFBISD is also getting S200 epiQ tracks, Major Play™ synthetic turf baseball and softball fields. As one CFBISD coach said, It’s like Christmas and a birthday all wrapped into one.

Together We Can!!!

Read about the new turf by clicking below:

𝐂𝐅𝐁𝐈𝐒𝐃 𝐒𝐂𝐇𝐄𝐃𝐔𝐋𝐄 𝐅𝐎𝐑 𝐆𝐑𝐀𝐁 𝐀𝐍𝐃 𝐆𝐎 𝐌𝐄𝐀𝐋𝐒
May 4 - May 8, 2020

GRAB AND GO MEALS

Be sure to check out the time that meals will be distributed at your neighborhood school.

Parents wishing to pick up 5 breakfasts and 5 lunches for their children should bring their children with them OR bring any one of the following items for each child not present.

🍎 Official letter/email from school listing children enrolled
🍎 Individual student report cards
🍎 Attendance record from parent portal of school website
🍎 Birth certificate for children
🍎Student ID cards

Unfortunately, we cannot provide meals without children being present or proper documentation.

Creekview, Newman Smith, Ranchview and Turner High Schools will each have an individual ceremony.

Times for each graduation ceremony and additional details will be shared with students and families in the very near future.

CFBISD Digital Coordinator Jeff Smith checks-in with Newman Smith's Director of the International Business Academy Kathy Holdge, on the latest edition of the "CFB Check-in!"

The International Business Academy (IBA) at Newman Smith HS, successfully accomplishes its mission of “giving students a foundation in marketing, economics, finance, language, and the cultural aspects of international business to become successful in their chosen area of business.”

Learn how the program and its Incubator EDU Entrepreneur class is adapting to the real world pandemic by going virtual to create their very own businesses, and pitch virtually to corporations to earn seed money.

Are you looking for fun activities for your elementary school-aged child during our campus closures?

Do you need printable pages to give your child when they are bored?

You are in luck. Carrollton-Farmers Branch ISD has created another FREE downloadable printable workbook for your children.

𝐃𝐨𝐰𝐧𝐥𝐨𝐚𝐝 𝐇𝐞𝐫𝐞 - https://bit.ly/2Ssx9GT

This fun, printable workbook has puzzles, mazes, coloring pages, crosswords, word finds and other fun activities. The downloadable file can be found at the bottom of the page.

post_text:
𝐂𝐅𝐁𝐈𝐒𝐃 𝐒𝐂𝐇𝐄𝐃𝐔𝐋𝐄 𝐅𝐎𝐑 𝐆𝐑𝐀𝐁 𝐀𝐍𝐃 𝐆𝐎 𝐌𝐄𝐀𝐋𝐒
April 27 - May 1

Be sure to check out the time that meals will be distributed at your neighborhood school.

Parents wishing to pick up 5 breakfasts and 5 lunches for their children should bring their children with them OR bring any one of the following items for each child not present:

🍎 Official letter/email from school listing children enrolled
🍎 Individual student report cards
🍎 Attendance record from parent portal of school website
🍎 Birth certificate for children
🍎 Student ID cards

Unfortunately, we cannot provide meals without children being present or proper documentation.

𝐅𝐢𝐧𝐝 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐬𝐞𝐫𝐯𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐭𝐢𝐦𝐞 𝐚𝐭 𝐲𝐨𝐮𝐫 𝐧𝐞𝐢𝐠𝐡𝐛𝐨𝐫𝐡𝐨𝐨𝐝 𝐬𝐜𝐡𝐨𝐨𝐥 𝐢𝐧 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐬𝐜𝐡𝐞𝐝𝐮𝐥𝐞 𝐛𝐞𝐥𝐨𝐰:
text:
𝐂𝐅𝐁𝐈𝐒𝐃 𝐒𝐂𝐇𝐄𝐃𝐔𝐋𝐄 𝐅𝐎𝐑 𝐆𝐑𝐀𝐁 𝐀𝐍𝐃 𝐆𝐎 𝐌𝐄𝐀𝐋𝐒
April 27 - May 1

Be sure to check out the time that meals will be distributed at your neighborhood school.

Parents wishing to pick up 5 breakfasts and 5 lunches for their children should bring their children with them OR bring any one of the following items for each child not present:

🍎 Official letter/email from school listing children enrolled
🍎 Individual student report cards
🍎 Attendance record from parent portal of school website
🍎 Birth certificate for children
🍎 Student ID cards

Unfortunately, we cannot provide meals without children being present or proper documentation.

𝐅𝐢𝐧𝐝 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐬𝐞𝐫𝐯𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐭𝐢𝐦𝐞 𝐚𝐭 𝐲𝐨𝐮𝐫 𝐧𝐞𝐢𝐠𝐡𝐛𝐨𝐫𝐡𝐨𝐨𝐝 𝐬𝐜𝐡𝐨𝐨𝐥 𝐢𝐧 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐬𝐜𝐡𝐞𝐝𝐮𝐥𝐞 𝐛𝐞𝐥𝐨𝐰:

Are you looking for fun activities for your elementary school-aged child during our campus closures?

Do you need printable pages to give your child when they are bored?

You are in luck. Carrollton-Farmers Branch ISD has created a FREE downloadable printable workbook for your children.

𝐆𝐞𝐭 𝐢𝐭 𝐇𝐞𝐫𝐞 - https://bit.ly/3aoDb0Y

𝐂𝐅𝐁𝐈𝐒𝐃 𝐒𝐂𝐇𝐄𝐃𝐔𝐋𝐄 𝐅𝐎𝐑 𝐆𝐫𝐚𝐛 𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝐆𝐨 𝐌𝐄𝐀𝐋𝐒 -
Week of April 20-24

🍎 GRAB AND GO MEALS 🍎

Be sure to check out the time that meals will be distributed at your neighborhood school.

Parents wishing to pick up 5 breakfasts and 5 lunches for their children should bring their children with them OR bring any one of the following items for each child not present.

▶️ Official letter/email from school listing children enrolled
▶️ Individual student report cards
▶️ Attendance record from parent portal of website
▶️ Birth certificate for children
▶️ Student ID cards

Unfortunately, we cannot provide meals without children being present or proper documentation.

𝐅𝐢𝐧𝐝 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐬𝐞𝐫𝐯𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐭𝐢𝐦𝐞 𝐚𝐭 𝐲𝐨𝐮𝐫 𝐧𝐞𝐢𝐠𝐡𝐛𝐨𝐫𝐡𝐨𝐨𝐝 𝐬𝐜𝐡𝐨𝐨𝐥 𝐢𝐧 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐬𝐜𝐡𝐞𝐝𝐮𝐥𝐞 𝐛𝐞𝐥𝐨𝐰:

post_text:
𝐆𝐨𝐯𝐞𝐫𝐧𝐨𝐫 𝐀𝐛𝐛𝐨𝐭𝐭 𝐫𝐞𝐥𝐞𝐚𝐬𝐞𝐬 𝐄𝐱𝐞𝐜𝐮𝐭𝐢𝐯𝐞 𝐎𝐫𝐝𝐞𝐫 - 𝐢𝐦𝐩𝐨𝐫𝐭𝐚𝐧𝐭 𝐢𝐧𝐟𝐨𝐫𝐦𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧 𝐟𝐨𝐫 𝐂𝐅𝐁𝐈𝐒𝐃 𝐟𝐚𝐦𝐢𝐥𝐢𝐞𝐬. 𝐋𝐞𝐚𝐫𝐧 𝐦𝐨𝐫𝐞...

April 17, 2020

Dear CFBISD Families,

Governor Abbott announced today that all Texas public schools are closed for the remainder of the 2019-20 school year. Please note that 𝐚𝐭-𝐡𝐨𝐦𝐞 𝐥𝐞𝐚𝐫𝐧𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐟𝐨𝐫 𝐂𝐅𝐁𝐈𝐒𝐃 𝐬𝐭𝐮𝐝𝐞𝐧𝐭𝐬 𝐰𝐢𝐥𝐥 𝐜𝐨𝐧𝐭𝐢𝐧𝐮𝐞 𝐚𝐬 𝐩𝐥𝐚𝐧𝐧𝐞𝐝, and grading procedures will be followed as previously shared.

The District will continue to provide updated information on meal distribution and graduation plans.

Thank you,

CFBISD Administration

𝐓𝐨 𝐋𝐞𝐚𝐫𝐧 𝐀𝐛𝐨𝐮𝐭 𝐆𝐫𝐚𝐝𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐏𝐫𝐨𝐜𝐞𝐝𝐮𝐫𝐞𝐬, 𝐂𝐥𝐢𝐜𝐤 𝐁𝐞𝐥𝐨𝐰

https://cfbisd.edu/covid19/covid-19-grading-procedures/

𝐀𝐝𝐝𝐢𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧𝐚𝐥 𝐆𝐮𝐢𝐝𝐚𝐧𝐜𝐞 𝐨𝐧 𝐂𝐥𝐨𝐬𝐮𝐫𝐞 𝐩𝐞𝐫 𝐄𝐱𝐞𝐜𝐮𝐭𝐢𝐯𝐞 𝐎𝐫𝐝𝐞𝐫 𝐧𝐨. 𝐆𝐀-𝟏𝟔

https://tea.texas.gov/about-tea/news-and-multimedia/correspondence/taa-letters/additional-guidance-on-closure-per-executive-order-no-ga-16
text:
𝐆𝐨𝐯𝐞𝐫𝐧𝐨𝐫 𝐀𝐛𝐛𝐨𝐭𝐭 𝐫𝐞𝐥𝐞𝐚𝐬𝐞𝐬 𝐄𝐱𝐞𝐜𝐮𝐭𝐢𝐯𝐞 𝐎𝐫𝐝𝐞𝐫 - 𝐢𝐦𝐩𝐨𝐫𝐭𝐚𝐧𝐭 𝐢𝐧𝐟𝐨𝐫𝐦𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧 𝐟𝐨𝐫 𝐂𝐅𝐁𝐈𝐒𝐃 𝐟𝐚𝐦𝐢𝐥𝐢𝐞𝐬. 𝐋𝐞𝐚𝐫𝐧 𝐦𝐨𝐫𝐞...

April 17, 2020

Dear CFBISD Families,

Governor Abbott announced today that all Texas public schools are closed for the remainder of the 2019-20 school year. Please note that 𝐚𝐭-𝐡𝐨𝐦𝐞 𝐥𝐞𝐚𝐫𝐧𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐟𝐨𝐫 𝐂𝐅𝐁𝐈𝐒𝐃 𝐬𝐭𝐮𝐝𝐞𝐧𝐭𝐬 𝐰𝐢𝐥𝐥 𝐜𝐨𝐧𝐭𝐢𝐧𝐮𝐞 𝐚𝐬 𝐩𝐥𝐚𝐧𝐧𝐞𝐝, and grading procedures will be followed as previously shared.

The District will continue to provide updated information on meal distribution and graduation plans.

Thank you,

CFBISD Administration

𝐓𝐨 𝐋𝐞𝐚𝐫𝐧 𝐀𝐛𝐨𝐮𝐭 𝐆𝐫𝐚𝐝𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐏𝐫𝐨𝐜𝐞𝐝𝐮𝐫𝐞𝐬, 𝐂𝐥𝐢𝐜𝐤 𝐁𝐞𝐥𝐨𝐰

https://cfbisd.edu/covid19/covid-19-grading-procedures/

𝐂𝐅𝐁𝐈𝐒𝐃 𝐏𝐫𝐞-𝐊𝐢𝐧𝐝𝐞𝐫𝐠𝐚𝐫𝐭𝐞𝐧 𝐑𝐞𝐠𝐢𝐬𝐭𝐫𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧 𝐟𝐨𝐫 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝟐𝟎𝟐𝟎-𝟐𝟎𝟐𝟏 𝐬𝐜𝐡𝐨𝐨𝐥 𝐲𝐞𝐚𝐫 𝐢𝐬 𝐨𝐩𝐞𝐧!

Parents can complete their PreK 2020-2021 registration process in two steps:

❤️ 𝐒𝐓𝐄𝐏 1️⃣: Parents can complete their online enrollment forms at www.enrollcfb.com

(Select the 2020-2021 school year)

❤️ 𝐒𝐓𝐄𝐏 2️⃣: When schools reopen, CFBISD staff will reach out to you to set up a time to finalize your registration and to see if you qualify for free Prek.

🔺 𝐒𝐩𝐞𝐜𝐢𝐚𝐥 𝐍𝐨𝐭𝐞 🔺: Parents wanting to enroll their child in Pre-K at a school outside of their attendance zone OR enroll in tuition-based PreK, must first apply and be approved for admission at https://cfbisd.edu/admission-application/ before registration can be finalized.

Space is limited for PreK transfers and for the PreK tuition-based program.

You can check your PreK attendance zone at www.cfbmaps.com.

𝐔𝐩𝐝𝐚𝐭𝐞 - 𝐈𝐧𝐟𝐨𝐫𝐦𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧 𝐟𝐨𝐫 𝐆𝐫𝐚𝐛 𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝐆𝐨 𝐌𝐞𝐚𝐥𝐬, 𝐌𝐚𝐫𝐜𝐡 𝟐𝟑.

Dear CFBISD Families,

As you may have heard, Dallas County has issued an order requiring residents to shelter-in-place effective 11:59 p.m. March 23 – 11:59 p.m. through April 3, 2020.

CFBISD will continue to provide Grab and Go meals on Monday, March 23, 2020, from 11:00 a.m. – 12:30 p.m. at Creekview, Newman Smith, Ranchview, and Turner High Schools.

After the District receives further clarification regarding the shelter-in-place order, CFBISD will send notify families on Monday regarding meal deliveries under the new order.

Please stay healthy and safe.

CFBISD Administration

𝐂𝐅𝐁𝐈𝐒𝐃 𝐄𝐱𝐩𝐚𝐧𝐝𝐬 𝐅𝐫𝐞𝐞 𝐌𝐞𝐚𝐥 𝐃𝐞𝐥𝐢𝐯𝐞𝐫𝐲 𝐭𝐨 26 𝐂𝐚𝐦𝐩𝐮𝐬𝐞𝐬

Carrollton-Farmers Branch ISD announced that it would expand free Grab and Go meal service to twenty-six campuses, March 24 – 27. The additional locations have been added to provide greater access to meals for ALL Children 18 years or younger during the school closure.

Grab and Go meal service will also continue Monday-Fridays, 11:00 a.m. – 12:30 p.m. at Creekview, Newman Smith, Ranchview and Turner High Schools. Children 18 years and younger are required to be present to receive a meal.

Children 18 years and younger are required to be present to receive the meal.

🔺 𝑵𝑶𝑻𝑬: 𝑻𝒉𝒆 𝒔𝒄𝒉𝒆𝒅𝒖𝒍𝒆 below 𝒊𝒔 𝒊𝒏 𝒆𝒇𝒇𝒆𝒄𝒕 𝒇𝒐𝒓 𝑴𝒂𝒓𝒄𝒉 24-27 𝒐𝒏𝒍𝒚. 🔺

Please visit www.cfbisd.edu/covid19/ for weekly updates and changes to the meal schedule.

🔺 Health Update #9 🔺

𝐂𝐅𝐁𝐈𝐒𝐃 𝐚𝐧𝐧𝐨𝐮𝐧𝐜𝐞𝐬 𝐬𝐜𝐡𝐨𝐨𝐥 𝐜𝐥𝐨𝐬𝐮𝐫𝐞 𝐮𝐧𝐭𝐢𝐥 𝐀𝐩𝐫𝐢𝐥 𝟑

All Carrollton-Farmers Branch ISD schools will be closed until April 3, 2020.

This action has been taken to help slow the spread of the coronavirus (COVID-19) and follows the advice from the Dallas County Health and Human Services department (DCHHS).

CFBISD Nutrition Services will continue to distribute meals at select campuses. At-home learning opportunities and resources can be found at www.cfbisd.edu. We will continue to provide you with updates.

Thank you for working with us as we unite with organizations across the community to respond to COVID-19.

post_text:
We know it can be hard to be confined to your home...

BUILDING YOUR CHILD’S VOCABULARY BY HAVING A FUN FAMILY GAME NIGHT

Read -> https://bit.ly/2IVsiIM

We know that students tend to learn best when they are having fun. So, how can we improve our student’s vocabulary while the whole family is having fun?

There are a number of games available at our local or online department and toy stores that can boost the depth, understanding, and fluency of your student’s language usage and vocabulary, all the while bringing the family together for an evening of fun!

post_text:
CFBISD Health Update - March 16, 2020 at 8 AM

Good Morning Parents,

During this week of school closure, we want to assure you that our goal is to keep you informed and updated and also provide helpful resources for you and your child.

Here are a few friendly reminders:

▪️CFBISD extra-curricular activities, including athletic events, are all canceled.

▪️CFBISD special events are canceled.

▪️Free Grab and Go lunches are available for all students from 11:00 a.m. - 12:30 p.m. at Creekview, Newman Smith, Ranchview and Turner High Schools.

▪️On Friday, we emailed parents at home learning suggestions and resources. The information you received included helpful learning tips and are optional for this week.

▪️Remember to follow the CDC tips such as hand-washing and social distancing.

Thank you for choosing to be a part of CFBISD. The district is committed to providing the best education and opportunities for your child. We appreciate your cooperation and flexibility. As always, the safety of our students, staff, and families remain a top priority.

post_text:
CFBISD Will Provide FREE Student Meals

CFBISD will provide free Grab and Go meals for any CFBISD student, Monday-Thursday, March 16-19, 2020, between 11:00 a.m. and 12:30 p.m.

Pick up locations are Creekview, Newman Smith, Ranchview and Turner High Schools.

Sanitation stations will be on-site, and social distancing will be put into effect during the pick-up process.

Please be prepared to provide your student’s id number that would normally be provided at their home campus cafeteria. Enter through the door that will be designated at each campus to pick up a meal.

Grab and Go meals will be packaged for pick up only. No meals will be served in the cafeteria.

post_text:
IMPORTANT UPDATE - CFBISD

Dear CFBISD Families,

Out of an abundance of caution for the health and well-being of our students and staff, we have decided that ALL Carrollton-Farmers Branch ISD schools will be closed Monday, March 16 through Friday, March 20, 2020.

All campus events, field trips, student trips and UIL practices and competitions are canceled until further notice. Additionally, all district offices will be closed.

As you know, this is a rapidly progressing situation that changes quickly. We understand that we will face many challenges, and we are grateful for your support and cooperation as we work together to keep CFBISD safe.

CFBISD will provide a more detailed update on Friday, March 13, via ParentSquare social media and the website at www.cfbisd.edu.

CFBISD will provide a more detailed update on Friday, March 13, via ParentSquare social media and the website at www.cfbisd.edu.

𝗛𝗲𝗮𝗹𝘁𝗵 𝗨𝗽𝗱𝗮𝘁𝗲 - 𝗖𝗢𝗩𝗜𝗗-𝟭𝟵 - 𝗠𝗮𝗿𝗰𝗵 𝟭𝟬, 𝟮𝟬𝟮𝟬

Dear CFIBSD Families,

As you may be aware, coronavirus (COVID-19) cases have been confirmed in the metroplex area. CFBISD is continuing to monitor this developing situation during spring break and will alert families with new information as it becomes available and as it pertains to our schools. Also, the district is continuing deep cleaning and sanitation measures of our facilities throughout spring break,

Sincerely,

Dear CFIBSD Families,

As you may be aware, coronavirus (COVID-19) cases have been confirmed in the metroplex area. CFBISD is continuing to monitor this developing situation during spring break and will alert families with new information as it becomes available and as it pertains to our schools. Also, the district is continuing deep cleaning and sanitation measures of our facilities throughout spring break,

Sincerely,

CFBISD Administration

post_text:
CFBISD Celebrates "Read Across America"

Read Across America Day, also known as Dr. Seuss Day, is a yearly observance in the USA inaugurated by the NEA (National Education Association). It is held on the school day that is nearest to 2 March, Dr. Seuss's birthday.

Theodor Seuss Geisel was an American artist, book publisher, animator, poet, a political cartoonist as well as an author. He is best known for authoring over 60 children’s books.

CFBISD Fine Arts is Incredible: All-State Announced

We are proud to announce that ten high school students in CFBISD from Creekview, Newman Smith, Ranchview, and RL Turner have been awarded the honor of All-State in Choir, Orchestra, and Band. All-State recognition in Fine Arts is an extraordinary feat.

Congratulations to the following students:

▪️Gerson Fuentes - R.L.Turner - All-State Tenor-Bass Choir
▪️Alex Gutermuth - Creekview - All-State Treble Choir
▪️Jakob Jeter - Creekview - All-State Tenor-Bass Choir
▪️Anna Merrill - Newman Smith - All-State Mixed Choir
▪️Kianna Montanez - Creekview - All-State Tenor-Bass Choir
▪️Esther Peng - Ranchview - All-State Philharmonic Orchestra
▪️Gerardo Rivera - Ranchview - All-State Symphonic Band
▪️Samuel Shin - Creekview - All-State 5A Symphonic Band
▪️Jacob Von Tress - Newman Smith - All-State Symphony Orchestra
▪️Natalie Wilson - Creekview - All-State 5A Symphonic Band

The AVID program in CFBISD is STELLAR!!!

Congratulations to Creekview AVID Senior, Jennifer Peña, on her acceptance to Stephen F. Austin. way to go!

AVID, Advancement Via Individual Determination

Regardless of their life circumstances, AVID students overcome obstacles and achieve success. They graduate and attend college at higher rates, but more importantly, they can think critically, collaborate, and set high expectations to confidently conquer the challenges that await them.

post_text:
Dallas-Area Prom Dress Drive Helps Deserving Ranchview Students to Dance the Night Away

Ranchview High School opens Becca’s Closet twice a year (for homecoming and prom) to students in need on their campus, as well as to other community high school students in North Texas.

While community shopping days this year are TBA, no appointment will be necessary to attend. Students can simply bring a school ID or document that shows they are currently enrolled in high school.

Becca's Closet takes monetary contributions, as well as donations of gently used dresses and accessories, at Ranchview High School, 8401 East Valley Ranch Pkwy., Irving.

https://www.beccascloset.org/donate/

Today was a special day for McLaughlin-Strickland Elementary, and especially for second grader Brayden who's father surprised him during an assembly after being deployed away from his family for five months!

All schools will be represented. This is a perfect opportunity to learn about all the excellent programs CFBISD has to offer for incoming pre-k and kindergarteners, as well as students that are outside our district.

- Demonstrations
- Games & Prizes
- Student Performances
- Expert Educators to Answer Questions
- Free Food & Hot Chocolate

Do not miss this awesome opportunity. Everyone is welcome. We hope to see you there.

CFBISD Students Recognized as Merit Scholars

Did you know... High school juniors take the PSAT qualifying test and are eligible for the prestigious National Merit Award. Of the 1.6 million students, some 50,000 with the highest PSAT scores are recognized as Commended Scholars and Semifinalists.

Additionally, the National Hispanic Recognition Program honors approximately 5,000 juniors. These recognized students are eligible for some of the most generous local, state, and national collegiate scholarship awards.

We are proud to recognize the following students in CFBISD:

🚨 Creekview High School 🚨

National Merit Commended Scholars:

▪️Asher Havens
▪️Bethany Merino
▪️Aritro Ray

🚨 R.L. Turner High School 🚨

National Merit Semi-Finalist:

▪️Isha Murugesan

National Merit Commended Scholars

▪️Samantha Bohn

National Hispanic Recognition:

▪️Gerson Fuentes

🚨 Early College High School 🚨

National Hispanic Recognition:

▪️Breonna Whittington

post_text:
Good Elementary Student Leads Canned Food Drive for Metrocrest

5th-grade student, Janiyah James, attends Good Elementary. Janiyah confidently helped lead the Metrocrest Canned Food Drive. She encouraged her classmates to donate food to Metrocrest that will be given to families who are in need locally.

Her passion for learning and acquiring knowledge knows no bounds. She is a PYP role model for all students at Good.

She wrote and read announcements on the school news network, collected cans, analyzed and interpreted the data.

Thank you for being an outstanding student and citizen, Janiyah!

CFBISD Launches Giving House to Help Students

Meeting BASIC NEEDS so students can SUCCEED

What is the CFBISD Giving House?

Carrollton- Farmers Branch ISD is launching a new initiative to help educate the whole child. We believe that no CFBISD child should go without food, clothes or supplies. Meeting the basic needs of students is essential to establishing a foundation for academic achievement. CFBISD Giving House is a place where staff can request specific items for students to have their basic needs met.

Learn More by Visting:

https://cfbisd.edu/giving-house/

post_text:
Pathway to Progress is Helping Mentor Males at Newman Smith

School staff from across the district have been recruited and have committed to mentoring young men. Ultimately, the objective of the program is to foster the development of confident students with leadership, decision making and interpersonal skills.

Staff will mentor students and help support their academic journey. They will provide additional resources to guide, support students’ success and meet individual goals. To be as impactful as possible, the majority of P2P’s program’s meetings will take place during the school day. Students will meet with mentors in small group settings at Newman Smith.

STEAM stands for Science, Technology, Engineering, Arts, and Mathematics.

Haggar Clothing Company Surprises Farmers Branch Elementary with Holiday Gifts

Farmers Branch Elementary teachers and staff had a big surprise before the holiday break, as the Haggar Clothing Company donated over $50,000 worth of gifts for the school and classrooms.

"We are extremely excited to give back to the community and the teachers and staff of Farmers Branch Elementary. We are grateful for you and all that you do."

Teachers received items ranging from digital smartboards to coding robots to furniture from their wishlists from the Farmers Branch company. CFBISD and Farmers Branch is appreciative of excellent public education supports like Haggar.

post_text:
Creekview Mock Trial & Moot Court Compete at YMCA Districts

This weekend, Creekview Mock Trial and Moot Court students competed at the YMCA Youth and Government District Conference in Duncanville. This is the qualifying event for YMCA State in Austin in January, which is the qualifying event for YMCA Nationals in Chicago in August. State qualifiers will be announced later this week.

In Moot Court, Sam Watkins and Aileen Mai tied for 3rd Place best judge, the team of Maeve Durkee and Isaac Yoo placed 7th, and the team of Makaylia Askew and Brian Kang placed 2nd (pictured below).

This year’s Mock Trial case dealt with minors under the influence and failure to yield to a pedestrian charge. The issues on appeal for the same situation in Moot Court were whether the use of peremptory strikes to remove all jurors of color was unconstitutional and whether the failure of the prosecution to disclose and the defense to request the victim’s history of traffic tickets was grounds for a new trial.
text:
Creekview Mock Trial & Moot Court Compete at YMCA Districts

This weekend, Creekview Mock Trial and Moot Court students competed at the YMCA Youth and Government District Conference in Duncanville. This is the qualifying event for YMCA State in Austin in January, which is the qualifying event for YMCA Nationals in Chicago in August. State qualifiers will be announced later this week.

In Moot Court, Sam Watkins and Aileen Mai tied for 3rd Place best judge, the team of Maeve Durkee and Isaac Yoo placed 7th, and the team of Makaylia Askew and Brian Kang placed 2nd (pictured below).

This year’s Mock Trial case dealt with minors under the influence and failure to yield to a pedestrian charge. The issues on appeal for the same situation in Moot Court were whether the use of peremptory strikes to remove all jurors of color was unconstitutional and whether the failure of the prosecution to disclose and the defense to request the victim’s history of traffic tickets was grounds for a new trial.

The Truth About Vaping - A CFBISD Parent Education Presentation

The CFBISD Council PTA held its monthly parent education seminar at Perry Middle School last night. Experts spoke on the growing epidemic of teenage vaping.

This video is a replay from the presentation. A spanish version will be avaliable in the future on YouTube. Thank you to all that attended. If you have questions, please feel free to let us know in the comment section below.

It might not happen this year, but if it does... Inclement Weather Protocols for CFBISD

Weather can be unpredictable and bring conditions that may impact our community and subsequently bring changes to the instructional day at Carrollton-Farmers Branch ISD campuses.

As inclement weather is predicated and approaches, the District will follow its Inclement Weather Protocols to determine if an adjustment to the instructional day is necessary to ensure student, staff and community safety.

https://cfbisd.edu/inclement-weather-protocols/

post_text:
CFBISD Opens Counseling Connections Center for All Students

CFBISD has established a new Counseling Center to meet the social and emotional needs of all students. Services are available to all CFBISD students and their families. Confidential sessions are offered on a short-term basis with a solution-focused approach.

Counselors

- Licensed Mental Health Professionals
- Certified School Counselors

Services

- Individual Counseling
- Family Counseling

Appointments

Tuesday & Thursday evenings
5 p.m., 6 p.m., and 7 p.m.

Center follows the district calendar

Contact

Counseling Connections Center
1820 Pearl Street, ESDC Bldg A
Carrollton, Tx. 75006

(972) 968-6620 Office
(972) 968-6581 Fax

Over 60 Dallas Officers Attend Fallen Sergeant Michael Smith’s Daughter’s Senior Night via CBS 11

For Victoria Smith, volleyball is her outlet — that’s what her mom, the widow of Dallas Police Sgt. Michael Smith, said.

“It’s the one thing that lets her keep going and it is something that her dad was very involved with,” Heidi Smith said.

At R.L. Turner High School’s varsity volleyball team’s senior night, Heidi said this a moment her husband would have cherished forever.

Theresa Nguyen Motter, who graduated Newman Smith in 1983, is Chief Executive Officer of Van's Kitchen. Van’s Kitchen is in 5,000 supermarkets and wants to expand into convenience stores over the next few years. The company is approaching $35 million in annual revenue.

post_text:
Former Newman Smith International Business Academy Student Honored as Forbes 30 Under 30

Sana Merchant, Newman Smith Graduate, advises the NFL's 32 clubs' executive teams on their social media strategy. Merchant also oversees all social reporting that is distributed from the NFL to the clubs and helps teams analyze the data.

She leads relationships with all major social platforms with which the NFL has deals—such as Facebook, Twitter and YouTube. She launched the Social Managers Workshop, an annual meeting for teams' social staff.

post_text:
Did you know...

CFBISD has an Anonymous Alerts anti-bullying and safety app that helps combat bullying and other negative activity in schools by empowering students to speak up?

The system allows for 1-way or 2-way anonymous encrypted communications between submitters (students, parents or community members) and district administration and/or school staff. Users of the system have the option to remain anonymous or reveal their identity when submitting a report.

Send reports from the web here:

https://report.anonymousalerts.com/cfbisd

To send a report from your phone:

1. Download the Anonymous Alerts® app for free from the Apple Store, Google Play store, or the Chrome store
2. Start the App, enter activation code: cfbisd
3. Send important reports to school officials
4. Add a screenshot, photo or video about the incident
text:
Did you know...

CFBISD has an Anonymous Alerts anti-bullying and safety app that helps combat bullying and other negative activity in schools by empowering students to speak up?

The system allows for 1-way or 2-way anonymous encrypted communications between submitters (students, parents or community members) and district administration and/or school staff. Users of the system have the option to remain anonymous or reveal their identity when submitting a report.

Send reports from the web here:

https://report.anonymousalerts.com/cfbisd

To send a report from your phone:

1. Download the Anonymous Alerts® app for free from the Apple Store, Google Play store, or the Chrome store
2. Start the App, enter activation code: cfbisd
3. Send important reports to school officials
4. Add a screenshot, photo or video about the incident

When Dr. Chapman, Superintendent of Schools, was asked, "Why Public Education?"

"I want to give back to those that may not see their full potential, give students a vision and goals to obtain.

There’s no better way to make a difference in life than to mold and develop the child."

CFBISD is LEADING the Way in STEM Education

STEM Classrooms are active and collaborative. Hands on projects bring students together to solve real world problems.

STEM Schools are dynamic. Science, technology, engineering and math are woven into everything a child learns, providing a common language that spans the globe.

Carrollton-Farmers Branch ISD is leading the way in STEM education and laying a foundation for every student to succeed.

Learn More About STEM Programs in CFBISD by visiting:

www.cfbstellar.com

post_text:
CFBISD Students Participate in Student Innovation Challenge

Ruby Alfaro, Marlene Cabrera, Dadah Smith and Lizbeth Carrera participated in the Student Innovation Challenge at the Texas Association of School Administrators/Texas Association of School Boards Convention, held in Dallas last weekend.

Students from four school districts came together to answer a challenge statement. The students researched and brainstormed ideas together, designed solutions, presented their plan to an audience and participated in a question-and-answer session over the course of two days.
text:
CFBISD Students Participate in Student Innovation Challenge

Ruby Alfaro, Marlene Cabrera, Dadah Smith and Lizbeth Carrera participated in the Student Innovation Challenge at the Texas Association of School Administrators/Texas Association of School Boards Convention, held in Dallas last weekend.

Students from four school districts came together to answer a challenge statement. The students researched and brainstormed ideas together, designed solutions, presented their plan to an audience and participated in a question-and-answer session over the course of two days.

post_text:
👻 Second Annual Halloween at the Ballpark 👻

Join us for an awesome slow-pitch Halloween game as CFB softball and baseball players compete against each other in costume. There will be Trick or Treating along with food and fun.

OCTOBER 30 at 5:00 PM

R.L. Turner Baseball Field
1600 S. Josey Lane, Carrollton, TX

Between innings, children will be able to run the bases and participate in on-field contests. Join us as we jam to a Halloween soundtrack.

Following the game, we will open the “midway” for carnival games, trick or treat fun, face painting, etc.

Admission is free, but we ask that you bring non-perishable food to benefit the Metrocrest Services Food Pantry.

post_text:
Furneaux Student’s Art Selected as Winner in DART Art Contest

Last year, as a 2nd grader at Furneaux Elementary, Dalena Livas participated in the DART Student Art Contest. Her art was selected to be displayed in the DART Artwork Exhibition at Dallas Love Field.

To enter into the Art contest, students had to use the theme “My next stop is _______.” (You fill in the blank!)

Dalena’s theme was “My next stop is 3rd Grade.”

To enter into the Art contest, students had to use the theme “My next stop is _______.” (You fill in the blank!)

Dalena’s theme was “My next stop is 3rd Grade.”

post_text:
Dan F. Long Band Joins SMU Band

Congratulations to the Dan F. Long Middle School Band for joining forces with the SMU Band last Saturday at Gerald J. Ford Stadium.

The Long Band got to perform alongside SMU in Dallas at their Saturday game against Texas State. The band's performance helped SMU go 3 - 0 on the season.

Way to Go, Falcons!

Student's of the Month Announced in CFBISD

Have you noticed our new yard signs around CFBISD? These signs are very special, as they represent a student being recognized for "Student of the Month" in CFBISD.

These exceptional students were chosen by their campus as awesome students that have qualities that make them shine.

Each time you see a "Student of the Month" sign in the community, remember all the great things happening in CFBISD and the awesome students that represent our district.

post_text:
Blalack Full Orchestra Awarded Prestigious Honor

We are EXCITED to announce that last year’s Blalack Full Orchestra, made up of students from the Honors Band and Symphonic Orchestra, have been selected as a 2019 National Winner of the Mark of Excellence Award!

Blalack was one of only three Middle School Full Orchestras in the country to be selected. This is a HUGE honor and testament to last year’s group for all of their hard work.

Please congratulate these students when and if you see them. Many of them have moved on to high school, but there are several 8th graders still on the Blalack campus!

Free New Shoes for All Davis Elementary Students

CFBISD students at Davis Elementary School received a special gift from Samaritan’s Feet International on Thursday. The nonprofit organization provided new shoes and socks to students as part of a special partnership with the school.

Staff and volunteers from Whataburger and Samaritan's Feet were on site to help with the distribution. Local elected officials from the community were also in attendance to help distribute shoes.

Don't Forget... CFBISD College Night is TONIGHT

Newman Smith High School will host College Night 2019 on Sep. 10, 6 - 8 PM. The event is open to students from all CFBISD high schools.

Over 100 colleges and universities will be represented. Parents and students are invited. Students grades 10-12 are encouraged to attend.

🎓 Over 100 Colleges & Universities
🎓 Students & Parents Invited
🎓 10th-12th Grade students are encouraged to attend.
🎓 Students, please register online
🎓 Financial Aid Sessions for Students & Parents
🎓 English & Spanish Sessions

This is a District-Wide Event

🚨 Register Online 🚨

Students are asked to register online at www.texascollegefairs.org.

Financial aid sessions for students and parents will be held in English and Spanish.

📍 Event Location 📍

Newman Smith High School
2335 N. Josey Ln.
Carrollton, TX 75006

post_text:
Campus Flu Immunization Clinics Cancelled

Due to circumstances out of our control, the company that was in charge of the Free Flu Immunization Clinics on our campuses has canceled the program. This was a nationwide decision by the company. We apologize for the inconvenience that might occur due to the cancellation.

If you have any questions, please contact your child’s school nurse. The health of students in CFBISD is very important. We apologize once again for this change.

post_text:
Monday, September 2 is a District Holiday – Labor Day

There will be no classes and district offices will be closed on Monday, September 2 in observance of Labor Day.
Classes will resume on Tuesday, Sept. 3, 2019.

Enjoy your break, have fun, be safe, and we’ll see you on Tuesday!

Doing something educational for the three day weekend?

Whether it's reading a book, practicing a musical instrument, or running bleachers – let us know with #cfblaborday

post_text:
Free Flu Shots on Your Campus

CFBISD has partnered with Healthy Schools to offer flu shots to your child during the school day. The copay is $0, so there is no cost to you.

Register your child today: www.fight-flu.com

Flu shots help protect everyone in our community from the flu - especially children, grandparents, and babies. Sign up your child to help us Fight the Flu this fall!

#CFBISDfightstheflu #flushotsmakeHealthySchools
